sub_topic: Show that every group of order 96 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C96, the alternating group A4 × C4 × C2, or one of the 196 non-abelian groups of order 96.
message_1: How many non-isomorphic groups of order 96 exist and what are they?
message_2:
There are 15 non-isomorphic groups of order 96. They can be described using their group presentation or by their Small Group label in the format SmallGroup(n, k), where n is the order of the group and k is the index in the list of non-isomorphic groups of that order.

1. C96 (Cyclic group of order 96)
2. C48 x C2
3. C32 x C3
4. C32 : C3 (Semidirect product of C32 and C3)
5. C16 x C6
6. C16 : C6 (Semidirect product of C16 and C6)
7. C8 x C12
8. C8 x (C4 x C3)
9. C8 : C12 (Semidirect product of C8 and C12)
10. C4 x C4 x C6
11. C4 x (C4 : C6) (Semidirect product of C4 and C6)
12. (C4 x C4) : C6 (Semidirect product of C4 x C4 and C6)
13. C2 x C2 x C2 x C2 x C3 x C2
14. C2 x C2 x C2 x (C2 x C3 x C2)
15. (C2 x C2 x C2 x C2) : C6 (Semidirect product of C2 x C2 x C2 x C2 and C6)

These groups can be further analyzed using their group presentation or by examining their properties, such as their subgroups, normal subgroups, and quotient groups.
